item.title: The car has been abandoned outside of our property for a number of months now, meaning those of us that live here have even further limited parking, 19th July
item.description:
Parking is suppose to be regulated and use to be, since this has not been the case for over two years we have ongoing issues with cars and large vans being left in our cul de sac

item.title: People feeding pigeons huge amounts of food resulting in vermin, 18th July
item.description:
There is zero enforcement of what I consider to be a serious issue on the Holly Grove shrubbery. Probably 10 times a day people arrive and dump huge amounts of bread, rice, cereal and unbelievably meat for the pigeons to eat. The sign explaining why this is self evidently a stupid thing to do has been graffitied and is illegible. The grass has all died and the rats are gorging on what's left at night. Please can the ban on feeding these wild animals be enforced? Or at the very least can there be much larger and clearer signage? I'd like to see a warning that people will,be fined and have it explained to them that this totally unnecessary feeding of inappropriate food is a problem for the residents as well as the actual pigeons! Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holly Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Commercial company flytipping, 18th July
item.description:

item.title: Flytipping and private property dumped on the public highway, 18th July
item.description:
Frequent flytipping under the bridge but the horsebox stuffed full of pallets and the VW camper van are permanent fixtures. The latter has not moved for at least six years. The horsebox has been dumped here a few months. I have some things I'd like to store in a shed but don't have the space, and would to store it for free until at least 2034. I can just drag my shed onto the kerb and leave it there, yeah? Ok cool.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fresh paint in middle of road., 18th July
item.description:
An upside down paint pot in the middle of entrance to car park; I moved it so a car wouldn’t hit it. The paint was already spilt. I stupidly didn’t take a before pic. Only after I thought to report it. A mattress. Hoover. This area is always a mess. Why can’t the bush be removed and a bricked bin house be installed. Now the new flats will no doubt cause more issues.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29,31,33,35, Ann Moss Way, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another reminder..., 19th July
item.description:
You attached the 7 day notice for removal on this bike OVER SIX MONTHS ago! We've sent several reminders, but it's still here. It's been so long, the writing on the notice has faded away! PLEASE REMOVE IF NOW.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Gould Terrace, Hackney, London
